alert.note: Alert for Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 5:31PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Missoula County through 600 PM MDT... At 530 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wye, or near Missoula, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Outdoor objects may blow around. Locations impacted include... Missoula, Lolo and Wye. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 93 and 105. Highway 93 N between mile markers 0 and 3. Highway 93 S between mile markers 88 and 89, and between mile markers 91 and 94. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region
